p: The regression model that describes the relationship between DT and the concentration of each compound of H. officinalis is presented in Figure 3. The best regression models were Exponential decay (Equation (3)) for α-pinene and sabinene; and Power (convex) (Equation (4)) for eucalyptol, α-terpinolene, β-linalool, β-bourbonene, α-muurolene, and bicyclogermacrene. There was no regression model that describes the relationship between DT and H. officinalis subsp. aristatus EO yield and the concentrations of β-pinene, β-myrcene, trans-pinocarveol, cis-verbenol, pinocarvone, cis-3-pinanone, terpinen-4-ol, cryptone, α-terpineol, verbenone, trans-carveol, cis-carveol, (-)-spathulenol, and caryophyllene oxide.
